isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - BATTERY, CHARGING AND CRANKING SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Ether Start

svcsubproc.title: Cummins and Caterpillar Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (24) is in the ignition or start position, power is available at circuit 13, fuse F2, circuit 21, connector (23), and the ether start switch. If the engine block temperature is below 10°C (50°F), the thermo switch (419) contacts will be closed. This will allow power to flow through the ether start switch, when it is depressed, through connector (23), circuit 21B, dash connector (2) and circuit 21B to the ether bottle control valve connector (500). Power then flows through the control valve, connector (500), circuit 21C, inline connector (600/719), circuit 21C and connector (709), to the thermo switch (419). When power flows through the ether bottle control valve, a shot of ether is fed into the intake manifold of the engine.

svcsubproc.title: International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (24) is in the ignition or start position, power is available at circuit 13, fuse F2, circuit 21, connector (23), and the ether start switch. If the engine block temperature is below 10°C (50°F), the thermo switch (419) contacts will be closed. This will allow power to flow through the ether start switch, when it is depressed, through connector (23), circuit 21B, and dash connector (2). From connector (2), power is applied through circuit 21A, connector (413), circuit 21A, connector (500) and circuit 21C, to the ether bottle control valve. Power then flows through the control valve, circuit 21B, connector (500), circuit 21B, connector (413), circuit 21B, and inline connector (709) to the thermo switch (419). When power flows through the ether bottle control valve, a shot of ether is fed into the intake manifold of the engine.
